def: One who tills; a husbandman; a cultivator; a plowman.
A luncheon; specifically, a light repast between breakfast anddinner.
An obstruction, or indigestible mass, found in the intestine ofbears and other animals during hibernation.

The disposition to favor and promote the interest of one personor family, or of one class of men, to the neglect of others havingequal claims; partiality.A spirit of favoritism to the Bank of the United States. A. Hamilton.
The soldering ir uniting of me [R.] Coleridge.
Filled with fancies or imaginations. [Obs.] Shak.
A strong caustic alkaline solution of potassium salts, obtainedby leaching wood ashes. It is much used in making soap, etc.
An order of Reptilia, which includes the lizards.

The principles of a political party in England (1838-48), whichcontended for universal suffrage, the vote by ballot, annualparliaments, equal electoral districts, and other radical reforms, asset forth in a document called the People's Charter.
